resources.description: Population projections to 2041 for London boroughs by single year of age and gender assuming no further development takes place beyond 2011. They are provided for comparison with SHLAA and other projections to show the impact of the assumed development.
resources.name: gla-popproj-2012rnd-zerodev-sya-borough.xlsx

resources.description: Population projections to 2041 for London wards by five-year age bands and gender using the Strategic Housing and Land Availability Assessment (SHLAA) housing data and incorporating household formation rates from the Department for Communities and Local Government (DCLG) interim 2011-based household projections.
resources.name: gla-popproj-2012rnd-shlaa-dclg2011hhrates-5yr-ward.xlsx

resources.description: Population projections to 2041 for London wards by five-year age bands and gender using the Strategic Housing and Land Availability Assessment (SHLAA) housing data.
resources.name: gla-popproj-2012rnd-shlaa-5yr-ward.xls

resources.description: Population projections to 2041 for London boroughs by five-year age bands and gender using 2009 SHLAA-based housing trajectories. These differ from the standard ward projections in that development data is used to distribute population at ward level, but the overall borough-level projection is constrained to the 2012 round trend-based population projection.
resources.name: gla-popproj-2012rnd-shlaa-trend-constraint-5yr-ward.xls

resources.description: Trend-based population projections to 2041 for London boroughs by single year of age and gender.
resources.name: gla-popproj-2012rnd-trend-sya-borough.xls

resources.description: Population projections to 2041 for London Boroughs by single year of age and gender using the Strategic Housing and Land Availability Assessment (SHLAA) housing data.
resources.name: gla-popproj-2012rnd-shlaa-sya-borough.xls

resources.description: GLA Update 05-2013 to accompany the 2012 round of population projections
resources.name: update-05-2013-2012nd-popproj.pdf

resources.description: Population projections to 2041 for London boroughs by single year of age and gender using the Strategic Housing and Land Availability Assessment (SHLAA) housing data and incorporating household formation rates from the Department for Communities and Local Government (DCLG) interim 2011-based household projections.
resources.name: gla-popproj-2012rnd-shlaa-dclg2011hhrates-sya-borough.xls

result.title: 2012 round population projections
result.name: 2012-round-population-projections
result.notes: IMPORTANT NOTE: These projections have been superceded, please see  https://data.london.gov.uk/demography/  for the latest GLA projections.   The 2012 round of projections were the first to incorporate initial results from the 2011-Census. The projections adopted ONS’s subsequent 2011 mid-year estimate as the base population from which to project forward. No migration data was available from the census to update the models so these used a mix of modified rates from the 2001 Census and rates taken from ONS’s 2010-based subnational projections. No population back-series consistent with the 2011 mid-year estimate was available at the time the projections were being produced. A consistent back-series is crucial for the projection process as it is used to generate the rates and propensities governing fertility, mortality and migration used in the projections. The GLA produced its own back-series consistent with 2001 and 2011 mid-year estimates. For this round, both trend-based and development-linked projections were produced. The development-linked projections made use of trajectories derived from the 2009 Strategic Housing Land Availability Assessment. Household formation rates were based on those from DCLG’s 2011-based household projections.
